page.title: 14The Wildlife of Shoreham
page.content: the Adur is a winter sanctuary require a saltmarsh to provide them with protection and food found on the exposed mudflats. Simply moving to another estuary is not possible. Estuaries are scarce and already carry as many birds as they can provide for. Many seagulls also use the area to roost at night away from predators. In 1982 Adur District Council sent out a report about a "Conservation Policy for the Widewater." The idea was to help the unemployed involving them in community services and other events. The work would include the removal of litter,the clearing of derelict areas and the culverting of the causeway to prevent stagnation. These were some of the ideas to improve the future of Widewater.
